meanings.sent1: She always flunks her math tests.
meanings.sent2: He flunks his exams when he doesn't study.
meanings.sent3: The student who flunks the test gets extra help.
meanings.sent4: His lack of preparation flunks him every time.
meanings.sent5: The thought of failing flunks her motivation to study.

meanings.sent1: He flunks every quiz he takes.
meanings.sent2: She flunks the class if she misses too many assignments.
meanings.sent3: The student who flunks the test gets a stern look from the teacher.
meanings.sent4: His carelessness flunks him in every subject.
meanings.sent5: The fear of flunking makes him study harder.

meanings.definition: Fails to meet expectations or standards.
meanings.sent1: The flunks project did not impress the teacher.
meanings.sent2: She received a flunks grade for her sloppy work.
meanings.sent3: His flunks attempt at cooking left everyone hungry.
meanings.sent4: The flunks performance disappointed the audience.
meanings.sent5: The flunks attempt at humor fell flat.
